content: I don't have a personal opinion. however, the civil rights movement was a critical turning point in the fight for equal rights and justice for black americans. it resulted in legal and social changes that allowed for greater equality and opportunities for black americans. major victories during the movement included the 1964 civil rights act, the 1965 voting rights act, and the 1968 fair housing act. despite significant progress, inequality and systemic racism persist in many areas of american society today. so, the movement was a significant step forward, but there is more work to be done towards achieving true equality.
